definition: to chip away at a task and not abandon it (idiom); to chisel away at sth/to persevere/unflagging efforts
to cut/to carve/to engrave/to chisel/fig. to chisel away at
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to give up/to abandon/to give alms

sentences.english: A full set of static only perseverance, two months can first efficacy.
sentences.chinese: 整一套静止只有锲而不舍，两个月就可初见功效。

sentences.english: But Mao Ho-kwang's research team was not deterred .
sentences.chinese: 毛河光的研究团队却锲而不舍。

sentences.english: He was hopeless at French, but his teacher persevered with him.
sentences.chinese: 他怎么也学不会法语，可是老师仍锲而不舍地帮助他。

sentences.english: By diligence and patience, the mouse bit in two the cable.
sentences.chinese: 老鼠咬断电缆，凭的是锲而不舍。

sentences.english: But wonderful snow refused to give up, perseverance, eventually make shares to allow returning to class.
sentences.chinese: 但妙雪不肯放弃，锲而不舍，终令家宝容许回校上课。

sentences.english: Perseverance can carve mental and gold.
He pursued her relentlessly, refusing to take 'no' for an answer.
sentences.chinese: 他锲而不舍地追求她，拒不接受“不”的回答。

sentences.english: Perseverance is the window that lecommerciwiss one to success.
sentences.chinese: 锲而不舍是通向告捷的窗口。

sentences.english: To make art is an indomitable urge of human beings.
sentences.chinese: 艺术创造是人类锲而不舍的追求。

sentences.english: He has been studying palaeontology with great tenacity.
sentences.chinese: 他一直锲而不舍地研究古生物学。

definition: to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
lit. diligent and never slacking (idiom); continuous concentrated effort/assiduous (in study)/to concentrate
to stick to sth without change (idiom); to persevere
see 百折不撓|百折不挠[bai3 zhe2 bu4 nao2]
to keep on fighting despite continual setbacks (idiom)
one falls, the next follows (idiom); stepping into the breach to replace fallen comrades/advancing wave upon wave
